content.raw:
Maybe I don’t understand the future plane with `<frame>`'s. I would’ve thought that this API would say something like: “Returns the pose X\_MJ of this joint J in the model frame M”.  
The fact that now it says “This is the raw pose value, as set in the SDF file.” leaves users of the SDF specification free to choose what this pose is, defeating the purpose of a “specification” as “specifying” a convention for everyone to follow.   
As a user for this API, this would mean that “I” have to keep track of frames and their poses relative to other frames. Why would I then use sdformat for? I could get that with an xml parser.  
Am I missing something here? I know that `<frame>`'s are a feature not supported yet but, shouldn’t the API reflect the future long term plan? \(and hopefully not that long term?\)

‌
